case_vignette: A 28-year-old man presents for severe abdominal pain and is diagnosed with appendicitis. He is taken for emergent appendectomy. During the procedure, the patient has massive and persistent bleeding requiring a blood transfusion. The preoperative laboratory studies showed a normal bleeding time, normal prothrombin time (PT), an INR of 1.0, and a normal platelet count. Postoperatively, when the patient is told about the complications during the surgery, he recalls that he forgot to mention that he has a family history of an unknown bleeding disorder. The postoperative laboratory tests reveal a prolonged partial thromboplastin time (PTT).
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I came in for severe abdominal pain.
Have you had any history of abdominal pain before?
No, this is the first time it has been this severe.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, I haven't had any recent changes.
Have you had any recent travel history?
No, I haven't traveled recently.
Have you had any recent medical procedures or surgeries?
Yes, I was just taken for an emergency surgery to remove my appendix.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
I didn't mention any medications when I came in for my symptoms.
Have you had any family history of abdominal pain or any other medical conditions?
I forgot to mention earlier, but I do have a family history of an unknown bleeding disorder.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Appendicitis with Bleeding Disorder.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The patient presented with severe abdominal pain, indicating it was the first time it had been this severe. There were no recent changes or travel history mentioned. The patient did not disclose a recent emergency surgery to remove the appendix but did mention having a family history of an unknown bleeding disorder after being asked about any previous surgeries and family medical history.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis in this patient is Hemophilia A.
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis in this patient is a gastrointestinal bleed.
